column5: Geeze...am I gonna have to come up there and show you how to catch some eyes for dinner? Man, its easy.  Just keep it light, and use live bait. You can't go wrong. It shouldn't even be legal its so easy......how can they resist a perfectly presented minnow? I use a 7' ultra light rod, with 6lb line. Use as little weight as you can get away with, and still keep contact with bottom.  I usually use a white 3" grub, on the lightest jig I can get away with, depending on conditions. Just a slow drag along bottom, just fast enought to keep the tail turning. They'll pick it up light, so if you even think it might be a fish....set the hook!!  Good luck up there bud, I might just show up.....ya never know  Sinker
I'm thinking you oughtta take a bible and a bazooka.

Dude I was thinkin about fishin that place too next week what a coincidents. Want to hook up and maybe fish together it will be a blast......As far as lures go you can't go wrong with a henway lure.....   Art
what's a henway?
Yo 'bama, did I ever tell ya, you look alot like my Uncle Fred..
Yeehaw..I'm serious!
Oh dear, this is starting out messy already.
Yup dawg's right on the answer Danbo  it's an old southern joke spelled hen weigh but that would have given away the joke. Here the other one whats heavier a lb of lead or a lb of feathers?.  Art
Who says that??? And why don't they like Mehta???
One word "Gulp"
Carolina rigs & floating jigs. Couple spinnerbaits or #4 gold willowleaf Mepps for pike. Some wire leaders too & needle-nose pliers. Portable FishFinder for depth control.
Dont forget your Snoopy rod and reel combo.
You'll need C4
Don't forget yer lucky hat!
And yore "Fish Billy"..they grow 'em big up there!!
A couple of rooster tail spinners...maybe a sabiki rig or two with some minners (no more than 4 hooks on rigs) and an old fart like me in your boat for luck...no bananers, I promisse...

I was up last week, found the pickeral slow, but still managed a few on worms bottom bouncing structure. Scored a 38" pike on a Mepps Black Fury. The pike I caught in the bays seemed to like spinners and spinnerbaits with chartuese in 'em. Andy
Last time you were in someone's boat you ened up bein' the bait!
A pink Rapala X-Rap thats what my boy out fishes me with when targetting Wall-ice
....I think a "crying towel" should bout cover it.
1/8 oz and 1/4 oz BLACK bucktail jigs.  If your bringing your own boat a extra prop. That area can be very dangerous.
....Ah, not exactly but you'll learn quick.
Glen, believe me....this will work up there!!...just be careful
There was a rumour floating around that certain people on this board swear by Jumla Lures........
What clothing???
Jumla definitely!   Cliff found one like this  to be effective last year
Deep diving Xrap silver/black back has been good to me in the area.
I overheard someone say that Beans was sitting on the floor from now on.  JF
Nah, you can have a young buck like him in your boat this year...I'll hide the banana  , just don't lean to far back in the seats  Maureen

EH!  Pike; Tube Jigs in thick weeds....and silver/orange bucktail 1oz willow leaf spinnerbait tipped with a twister.... Johnson's silver minnow tipped with twister.... anything that'll keep ya above the abundant weeds  works ... in deeper water the X-Rap works well.  Walleye .... well .... go where all the other boats are after supper. Bring worms and jigs with a trailer hook.  Was there last weekend in the rain and did pretty good...lotsa medium sized fish... nothing that was camera worthy... but alot off fun.   Good Luck.  Randy
I'm with you Randy,after dinner wallice kickass!Just dont follow Wayne! Joe
